ratings.comment: Mandatory discussion attendance with pop quizzes in discussion. Lowest quiz score is dropped. Steve is incredible as a lecturer. This is a class I truly enjoyed going to and it wasn't very difficult either. Class was less about rhetoric than it was about the history of abolitionism and the civil rights movement, but I learned a ton.

Lucas is a fantastic professor. His lectures are captivating, and he teaches in a passionate manner. You cannot miss his lectures because typically each lecture corresponds to one exam question. This course broadens horizons and will leave you with a newfound respect of rhetorical tactics/strategies.

This was the most dry class I've ever been in. The description of the course was a bit misleading, it's almost just as much of a history course, less of "campaigns and revolutions". But as dry as the content was, Lucas did an alright job at keeping my attention for the full lecture. Tests were pretty difficult & group projects are always the worst
Great lecturer. He is passionate about the topic and is incredibly engaging, it is hard to not pay attention. Tests are tricky, but even the readings are interesting. A must take class.

I did not have Lucas as a teacher personally, but he wrote our exam and textbook for Com-Arts 100. The way the exams are graded show that Lucas cares only for memorization of his textbook's keywords, not actual comprehension of the material. In addition, the way we have to write speeches encourages us to be boring speakers.
Lucas suck, His tests were hard and had a guidline for TA's in which if u didnt state a specific word/words in your answer then the highest you could get was a B/C

Amazing speaker.  Super captivating class.  Exams are not easy, the essays are graded a bit too critically, in my opinion but the class is interesting and you'll do fine if you study and know the material well.  Plus, you feel a lot better when you do well than in an easy class.

Not an easy class, but Lucas makes it pretty interesting.  You can't really skip class if you want a good grade.  Readings aren't necessary, but they can be helpful.  Multiple choice questions are tough.

My favorite professor so far at UW. His lectures are interesting even though the material could be boring if anyone else taught it. You need to go to class. The multiple choice on the exam really test if you have been paying attention. Readings are not necessary to do, just take good notes.

He wrote the book for public speaking, and it shows. Even if you're not interested in the topic, you can't help but pay attention. You HAVE to go to class to do well. Your grade is comprised of 3 written exams. It's offered very irregularly, so if you're lucky enough to be at the university when it's offered, TAKE IT! You won't regret it.
TAKE HIS CLASS!!!He makes uninteresting things very interesting. He's passionate about what he's teaching I highly recommend you take it. it also fills the ethnic studies requirement.
Prof Lucas is amazing! I adore him and this class.  He is so knowledgeable and passionate about public speaking and it rubs off.  The class is interesting and if you pay attention pretty easy!

I also love this man. He's a great lecturer who presents his material in a completely logical manner. The tests are of moderate difficulty but they are a great measurement of how well you understand the material. Go to lecture and the readings are unnecessary. This is one of the best classes I've ever taken.

I also love this man. He wrote the book on public speaking, and it shows. He's fun to listen to, even if you're not particularly interested in the actual things he's saying. I hope to take more of his classes.
i love this man. he deserves all of those teaching awards he received, really is an amazing teacher.
